document_data.name: Tombstone Golem
document_data.refs3e: ''[[Libris Mortis]]'' doesn't specify whether a tombstone golem variant can only be applied to Standard or Greater stone golems, thus it must be assumed that such golems can likewise be of either size.<ref group="note" name="CR">The entry for tombstone golems in ''Libris Mortis'' states that their challenge rating should be that of a stone golem, but raised by 2.
document_data.mainbody: '''Tombstone golems''' were a deathtouched variant of [[stone golem]]s with their bodies composed of the stone of various fused together tombstones and [[necrotic energy]].
document_data.Abilities: These [[construct]]s lacked a stone golem's ability to ''[[slow]]'' other creatures, but in its place had a supernatural ability comparable to the [[spell]] ''[[slay living]]''. Additionally, they could inflict baneful doses of necrotic energy upon living creatures they touched. And if destroyed, their bodies would violently explode, sending out shards of stone and a burst of necrotic energy.
document_data.Combat: Much like a standard stone golem, these constructs relied heavily upon their fists to harm the opposition.

Society.Construction: On average, building a tombstone golem required the spell ''slay living'' and around approximately 70,000 [[gold piece]]s.

document_data.History: Around {{YearlinkName|1479}}, a group of [[adventurer]]s traveled through a [[portal]] beneath the city of [[Myth Drannor]], taking them into [[Shazryl's tower]] in the [[Shadowfell]]. There they encountered a great number of creatures under the [[alhoon]]'s command,<ref>{{Cite organized play/LFR/Ghosts of the Past: Dark Portal|4-6}} including a trio of [[forsaken shell]]s that guarded a room alongside a tombstone golem.<ref>{{Cite organized play/LFR/Ghosts of the Past: Dark Portal|5,33}}
